Utterance: Welcome back! It’s good to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! I’ve been okay. I tried to implement some of the strategies we discussed.
That’s fantastic to hear! Which strategies did you find helpful?
I did a bit of meditation each day, and I reached out to a friend to talk about how I was feeling.
That’s wonderful progress! How did your friend respond?
She was really supportive. It felt good to share what I’ve been going through.
That’s great! Connecting with others can be really healing. How did it feel to open up to her?
It was a relief, honestly. I felt lighter afterward.
That’s a powerful feeling. Have you noticed any changes in your anxiety or feelings of overwhelm since implementing those strategies?
A little. I still have moments of anxiety, but they don’t feel as overwhelming as before.
That’s a positive shift! It sounds like you’re beginning to build resilience. Are there any new challenges you’ve encountered since we last spoke?
Well, I’m still dealing with the stress of my living situation. It’s hard to manage that negativity.
It can be tough to maintain your own emotional well-being in a challenging environment. Have you been able to create any boundaries?
I’ve tried to spend more time outside and not engage too much in her negative talk, but it’s hard to avoid it completely.
Setting boundaries can be difficult, especially when living with someone. What do you think would help you maintain those boundaries more effectively?
I think I need to be more assertive. I sometimes feel bad saying no.

It’s understandable to feel that way. Remember, being assertive is about respecting both your needs and the other person’s. Would you like to practice some assertive communication techniques together?
That would be helpful!
Great! Let’s say your housemate is complaining about something. How might you respond assertively while still being compassionate?
Maybe I could say something like, “I understand you’re frustrated, but I need to focus on my own well-being right now.”
That’s a good start! It acknowledges her feelings while also prioritizing your needs. How does that feel to say?
It feels empowering! I like that I can still be kind but also stand up for myself.
Absolutely! Empowerment is key. As you practice this, it may become easier to set those boundaries. Have you been able to incorporate any mindfulness techniques into your routine?
Yes, I’ve been doing five minutes of mindfulness each morning. It really helps ground me.
That’s excellent! Starting your day with mindfulness can set a positive tone. Have you noticed any changes in your mood or mindset since starting this practice?
I feel a bit more centered. It helps me approach the day with a clearer head.
That’s wonderful to hear. Mindfulness can be a powerful tool for managing anxiety. Is there anything else on your mind today?
I still worry about my career and what direction I want to go in.
It’s natural to have concerns about your career, especially during transitions. Have you made any progress on the online course you wanted to take?
I signed up for a course on digital marketing! I’m excited to start.
That’s fantastic! Learning new skills can be a great way to feel more prepared for your career. What do you hope to gain from this course?
I hope to gain more confidence in my skills and maybe open up new job opportunities.
That’s a great goal! Remember, it’s about progress and growth. Have you thought about how you’ll balance this course with your other responsibilities?
I plan to dedicate a couple of evenings each week to it. I think I can manage that.
That sounds like a reasonable plan. Just remember to be kind to yourself if things don’t go perfectly. You’re doing a lot of important work right now.
Thanks, Ellie. I really appreciate your support.
Of course! I’m here to help. Let’s continue to check in on your progress and feelings in our next session.
Sounds good! I’m looking forward to it.
Me too! Take care until then.
Bye!
Goodbye!
